revised_title: Fossil Flora of the Forest of Dean Coalfield and Relationships of Coalfields
tldr: The author examines the fossil flora of the Forest of Dean Coalfield in Gloucestershire, England, and discusses the relationships between the coalfields of the West of England and South Wales. They describe the geology and structure of the area, focusing on the Upper Carboniferous rocks and the plant remains found within them. The author also discusses the challenges of collecting fossil plants from different coal seams and the importance of understanding the vertical distribution of the fossil flora in this region.
